Wine selection was good too with a bit of something for everyone. Revelry is quite the charming neighbourhood restaurant, all the other diners seemed to know the hosts and chef so it was a very nice, friendly atmosphere to be in.
author: Katie M.

description: A real SF neighborhood French bistro , price is reasonable ,  service is good , nice ambiance , all dishes ordered met or exceeded exceptions - really liked this place , when the parents visit from out of town it is going to be La Folie or Gary Danko ( SF white glove action) but with local SF area friends, who don't need the glove action as much as good food / good place - going back to Revelry !
author: Chris B.

description: We had a great Sunday brunch at Revelry Bistro: the Eggs Benedict was amazing and French Toast was like dessert.  The service was friendly and smooth.  The dining room is small so make a reservation, but it is worth it.
author: Dean B.

description: Off day. Wasn't impressed. Foie gras appetizer leaves you wanting. Flavor not present. Steak flavorless .. meat soft but truffle butter leaves you wanting as well. Disappointed.
author: Koalie W.

description: Loved this neighborhood find. Intimate setting. Lovely service. Great wine options. Tasty French inspired food. We loved the sole, pasta and paella. Trout salad mot to be missed!
author: amy l.

description: We had a big party, and the staff was super accommodating and helpful in giving appetizer recommendations. We started with the cheese board, and the truffle tremor was heavenly. Unfortunately, the rest of the meal was disappointing--paella had no flavor at all.
author: Benjamin A.

description: We love this place for their oyster happy hour. $2 for excellent fresh oysters, great patio seating, and friendly service from Drake. We'll keep coming back!
author: Justin H.

description:
This place is a gem! Quiet, intimate, romantic, and delicious! Everything was so fresh. We needed a place open late for dinner on a Thursday night and stumbled upon this bistro. It is the perfect place for a date night. 

The bone marrow was cooked perfectly. The mushroom risotto was bursting with flavor. My tomato salad was beautiful and delicious. This is going into our date night rotation. 

Also, I hear they do brunch now so we'll be back to check that out. More to come...
author: Vanessa L.

description: Just threw hubby his surprise birthday party in Revelry's private room. Not only did Jerome, the owner, help me plan this down to the wire, but the food was outstanding. My group of 18 guests, who are foodie professionals and quite picky, all enjoyed the exquisite French fare. This is an authentic farm-to-fork restaurant where the executive chefs lovingly curate the superb ingredients at local farmers' markets. We ordered a variety of duplicates: one of each salad (endive, duck confit, beets, Brussels sprouts), steak and eggs: medium rare, croque-monsieur, eggs Benedict, smoked salmon Benedict, the garden Benedict, Banana Fosters French Toasts, and sets of the 3-choice charcuterie (we selected salami, prosciutto, and speck). Our faves? Hands-down, the steak was divinely cooked and seasoned to perfection. The smoked salmon eggs Benedict were soft, palatable, and creamy. The Bananas Fosters French Toast had this delectable caramel sauce that was pure addiction. The Brussels spouts Cesar salad was gone by the time I turned around, and after we ordered another, poof! Clearly, a hit. Claudia and Chris served us with warm hospitality. We even had 4 kids in the group, and they had the high chairs and well thought-out seating arrangement all ready when our guests arrived. This was a birthday brunch, but I've been here for a birthday dinner as well, and their food is simply outstanding. If you're looking for something intimate and accommodating for all age groups, with delectable French food, check this place out!
author: T H.

description:
If you have come to live in San Francisco in, say, the last decade, and have been seeking the spirit of Bon vivant, pauvre-gentile, bohemian, auld City, come to Page Street to find it. 

Jerome will greet  you at the door, seat you in one of Revelry Bistro's cozy tables, and fold you into what San Francisco is.

Go ahead, order any bottle of wine in the list. They are all excellent.  Do err on the side of France - pay particular attention to the Loire, Provence, Bourgogne.

Fresh, select, unfussy food.  The menu is tightly constructed, no missteps.  Indecisive? Ask Jerome and he will guide you with care and genuine interest.

Do have a few courses. Linger.  Remember why it's good to be alive...why it is, indeed, so good to be alive.
author: Patricia P.

description: Oh man this place is delicious! Got a cheese plate, the couscous, the halibut, and the profiteroles for dessert. A bit pricey, but perfect for a special occasion. Best halibut I've ever had. To die for.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
I went here for my birthday with a group of 12 people. They have a great table/area for bigger groups. 

Pros
Location, accommodating, atmosphere (at least at the group table) and food. 

The food was good but not amazing. I'd certainly eat there again after they've had time to fix the cons below.

Cons
My party arrived within 5 minutes of our reservation time and though we were immediately seated it was over 40 minutes (I checked) before we could even put a drink order in. They need additional wait staff badly. We kept asking the water guy to get the waitress for us but he just helplessly shrugged and continued to fill our water several times before she came over. We even had to ask for menus twice. Not the best vibe for starting a birthday celebration at all. 

The food came our pretty slowly as well. I would have given this place 3 stars if they weren't new. I think they'll work out their wait staff issues and end up being a solid neighborhood spot. I recommend going with just a couple of people rather than a large group - at least for the next couple of months while they work out the kinks.
author: Amber F.

description: What a lovely hidden gem in the Hayes neighborhood - just opened in March.  The owners are a wonderful couple and the manager has a gorgeous authentic French accent!  Great wine selection and impressive menu that changes daily.  Great for small groups, client dinners and date nite!  Highly recommend!
author: Carmelita B.

description:
I had a great meal here! We got the crudo and foie gras - both amazing! I had the trout niçoise, which was great and my boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed his filet mignon! Wanted to order almost everything on the menu. The service was also amazing. Will be back! 

I also plan to return to check out the happy hour with $1 oysters. :-)
author: Camilla F.

description: Garden Benedict was great!  Good service.  Nice, relaxed atmosphere.  Not a huge wait, which is rare in this hood
author: Andrew O.

description:
I would say half of our dishes were just ok. The other half were total fails. For example the creme brûlée was not only broken, the ramekin was too shallow which made the creme very warm. We didn't even finish it which is unheard of. The naked oysters were also too soggy. No Crispy crust. Which might be due to the fact  Two courses were certainly sitting and waiting to long because the food was luke warm or weepy. And the lobster bisque, aka lobster water was below warm, almost cold, not creamy at all and was flavorless. The worst part was our waiters attitude. He talked down to us several times and through out the whole meal giving people the wrong dish. He spent more time chatting to friends at the bar than serving. 

The image of their food is greatly misleading on their website. Named the size of their portions or dishes. Plan to leave hungry. We ordered the steak dish and I only got 4 asparagus stems and I think 5-6 potatoes. Hidden under a small cut of meat. Meat was cooked perfectly but when you run out of side before your meat. Then something is wrong. Also the little gem salad is grilled. Or at least mine was which was not mentioned on the menu. The heat from the lettuce was cooking the salad dressing which I think was Caesar. Don't know never mentioned in menu and even when I asked the waiter he ignored my question and walked away. 

A friend recommended the radishes and don't get me wrong I love fresh veggies. But cleaned radishes sprinkled with sea salt does not make a dish. Oh and the asparagus was so over cooked the tips were shriveled up shrubs. I recommend walking down the street to Absinthe or Frances for a more dependable meal. And nicer service.
author: brian k.

description:
Came here to celebrate my birthday with my cousins. We were a party of 6 and Jerome was our server. We tried the Escargot, Foie Gras, Charcuterie plate with Brie, and the cauliflower gratin, which were all exceptional, especially the Foie gras. My mouth is watering just thinking about it! We also had the Bone Marrow and Oysters, which were decent, but I'd order more of the the Foie Gras and Escargot next time instead. 

For dinner, we tried the Filet Mignon, Duck confit salad, and Beef Bourguignon, and they were also all exceptional as well. We tried a few desserts, which were quite good as well.

On top of the exceptional food, the service was amazing as well. Our server Jerome was knowledgeable and helpful, and his recommendation for wine pairings were on point! 

All in all, the food was great, the service was great, and the place was great! I'd definitely come back here again. 

Thank You guys for making my Birthday celebration a special one!

P.S. Make sure you arrive 10-15 minutes earlier since parking around the area is scarce, at least on weekends. 

I
author: B I.

description: Amazingly beautiful food, like eating art.  stopped in for a light bite, had the cheese board and marinated olives...lovely.  gracious service from beautiful Silvana...we'll be back for dinner.
author: Joan B.

description: Love the food - heirloom tomato salad was really good and so was the salmon.  High quality ingredients and well prepared by the chef!  Really good stuff.  Service was inadequate.  The waiter was overwhelmed, staffing level seemed light.  Took forever to get basics and there was some miscommunication.  One of the partners had to step in.  Irregardless, we would go back for the food.
author: Glenn S.

description:
Short version: Absolutely awesome. 

Longer version:
Came here for one of the opening nights. We had a number of the smaller dishes including oysters, shrimp, charcuterie, the wedge salad with blue cheese and candied bacon and a cheese plate. For desert we had the creme brûlée. Everything was incredible and I can't wait to have dinner here again.
author: Napalm M.

description: Ok, not great. Had the trout salad which barely had any trout. But fresh and tasty brussel sprout salad. Service was ok. A little overpriced. Great biscuit.
author: Nancy R.

description:
I am happy this place opened. I always loved this spot, and went when it was a tea lounge, so I was sad to see that go. But I am happy Revelry  took over. I love the intimate feel, without being stuffy or feeling crowded. I tried the cheese and meats plates and I could have stopped there, and been happy,  as they were all so freaking good.
But... Snails!! I LOVE snails, and these were great. My friend had the meat in a flaky pastry and I tried some of that and really wanted more, so I will order it next time. I like how you can do a full meal, or just grab a plate of yummy meats and a beer and chill out and people watch. Great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Jo J.

description: Brunch with the family.  Great service, food and Sunday Bev's. Clean and a nice touch w Easter eggs hidden in the bench seats.  Beets salad awesome!
author: Bill B.

description: Went here for brunch and was so disappointed. They were out of granola and yogurt, which I find unacceptable as we were there just as the restaurant opened. The french toast, nearly $20, was ONE slice of french toast. The tomato jam was far too sweet. The water smelled funny. The eggs of the day were watery and much too salty. The waiter gave us major attitude about asking for diet coke.
author: Lady B.

description:
Our party of 8 dined at Revelry tonight before the symphony concert and had a fabulous meal. Overall impression: authentic French bistro fare in a cozy, casual environment. 

We had some amazing starters: 
 
- very fresh salad with melon, cheese, almonds, a light and delicate dressing
- an extraordinary cheese plate 
- flavorful sweet breads 
- lobster bisque - a must 

It's easy for restaurants to hit the right notes with the starters but the true test of a chef's mettle is the protein course. We all had either filet mignon or sole meuniere and all 8 of us were thrilled with our entrees. The beef was melt-in-your-mouth tender, the sole was perfectly crisp/lightly salted on the outside and tender inside, with a delish buttery caper sauce. Service was gracious, warm, welcoming. We'll be back!!
author: SfMom O.

description: Just finished an Easter brunch as this new find, for me.  Years ago I lived across the street and fondly recall the excellent food I got there when it was Green Gulch Grocery.  Today, it is this amazing French bistro with outstanding service and food.  My party of three tried different dishes wand we happy with all of then.  My French toast was outstanding.  The warm bananas served along with fresh fruit  as inspiring.  Loved the unflavored whipped cream.  The Croque Monsieur was well done with shaved ham slices and fried potatoes.  One guest enjoyed the Garden Benedict, with fresh pesto and wonderfully poached eggs.  Will definitely try the place for dinner.  My sole complaint was the choice of music.  Something much softer would have been appreciated, either classical jazz or classical while eating such outstanding food.
author: James S.

description: This is a cozy little restaurant I found while wandering around. It seems to get busy, so reservations are in order if you want a table. Was on my own, so was able to grab a seat at the bar. I had the bone marrow appetizer and the filet mignon. Both were excellent. If you're looking for a good date night spot or dinner with friends (or just feel like treating yourself), this place will do the trick nicely.
author: Cori D.

description:
Went for Saturday brunch with my daughters and husbands, one was visiting from out of town. Had a 1:00 reservation. Had been told it would take a few minutes to be seated. Meanwhile we're looking at an empty table upstairs (maybe was reserved?). About 20 minutes later, that's where we were seated??  

After being seated, we were immediately given menus and a beverage list. Soon after our server came back to get our beverage order. Then, nothing for about 20-25 minutes. Really tested our patience, thought of walking out.  Finally came to take our order. Then about another 25-30 minutes before getting our order. 

After asking for the bill, it was delivered fairly shortly. Then, nothing. After about 15 minutes, we got up, walked out and paid at the register. 

I will say, the food was delicious, cod, oysters, Pan Bangnat. We were on a bit of a time schedule. Don't know if the time and lack of service was worth it.
author: Debra H.

description:
It's a pleasure to write this review as it was a pleasure to wonder upon a gem like Revelry.  The chef-owner came around to check on how I liked my meal, the bartenders and wait staff were warm and friendly - it felt like I wandered into a  large happy family gathering and instantly felt welcome.

As for the food, &*%#!  so good!  i started with the happy hour oysters which totally hit the spot and gently primed my pallet for the taste adventure that was to come.  

my smoked trout brussel sprout salad with just absolutely perfectly creamy caesar salad dressing, and shaved cheese - served on leaves of butter lettuce - was simple yet delicious.  The fresh as can be thin sliver-cut brussel sprouts provided a contrasting crunch and a bright green flavor for the salty creamy fishiness of the dressing and the trout smokiness mingled with all the other flavors.  The result was multilayered and resonant, this is the kind of thing that makes me feel very grateful, inspired. 

Can't wait to try the other things - I hear the squid salad is a religious experience.

FYI - They have a beautiful room in the back that hosts 25 people dinner parties.
author: tatiana k.

description: Accommodating, I had arranged a birthday candle for my husband's birthday and they accommodated at well, the whole restaurant saying happy birthday for him. Food is good. Thank you.
author: Dibina F.

description: Perfect place for our Sunday Brunch! Exquisite food and terrific service. All 4 of us had something different and we all thoroughly enjoyed our dishes.
author: Jayne D.

description: We recently returned for our second visit to Revelry Bistro.   Our first experience was so good we couldn't wait to return.   At the first visit, we shared a salmon is puff pastry that was simple yet elegant.  The owner, Jerome, when we asked for the recipe, didn't hesitate to offer it.  We've prepared it three times at home to much acclaim (and enjoyment).    This visit my partner had a very nice salmon and I had boeuf bourguignon.   Both were excellent and hit the spot.   We shared a wonderful pinot noir that we brought.  Jerome was nice enough to comp us the corkage fee.    The place is small with an intimate feel.   With the high ceilings, it was easy to hear even though the restaurant was full.   Can't wait to return.
author: Malcolm J.

description: The perfect combination of great food, service, and atmosphere at a reasonable price. As an example, not many places use filet mignon for their beef tartar. WIll definitely come back!
author: Peter J.

description: My Go-To place for an early dinner or weekend brunch! I would give them my 3Gs rating - Great food, Great Vino, Great Service! And not to mention great atmosphere - casual, relaxed and always bustling. The oysters and marrow are MUST haves. I've had marrow in many restaurants around the world and Revelry has one of the best!
author: Keith L.

description: I fell in love with this space when it was a tea house, and, though we were a little put off by the look of the new sign out front, my tea friend and I finally decided to try Revelry Bistro for dinner.  We were both blown away by the delectable, but not fussy, food and still-wonderful vibe. On that basis, I chose Revelry as the venue for a brunch I hosted last weekend to celebrate my City Hall wedding a few days before.  I reserved the entire upper space, toward the back of the restaurant, for our party of 18. (I was rightly admonished that it gets pretty crowded at 22.) The Revelry folks were absolutely wonderful from start to finish: really nice and easygoing, but utterly professional. After a few email exchanges about basic parameters with Brad, the chef, and Jerome, the maitre d', I decided to have parts of the meal served family style.  At that point, Jerome asked me to come down so we could discuss menu and logistics. He spent a good hour with me one afternoon about five days before the party, liberally popping the corks on expensive champagne bottles for me to sample so I could choose what to pour for my guests.  Then we chose a menu: a few appetizers (cheeses, olives, radishes); three different salads; and five different entree options. I also wanted my guests to be able to order any kind of coffee drinks they wanted, and wine, beer, and other non-champagne drinks, and that I would bring cake for dessert. My favorite moment of the meeting was when Jerome looked at me soberly and said, "This is going to be your day, and I want you to have a wonderful party, but we will need the space back to prepare for other guests.  So you have to make sure everyone is out of there by . . . 4 pm."  (The brunch was starting at 11!) I told him that would not be a problem. He took copious notes, and emailed me later that evening to confirm everything we had decided, including the title of the event, to appear at the top of the little menu cards he would have printed specifically for the brunch. The party itself was just plain glorious. I showed up early to bring the cakes and lay down name cards.  The lovely wooden table was set beautifully, bistro style, little jars of fresh flowers down the middle, no table cloth.  Champagne was chilling in buckets of ice, flutes beautifully set out waiting to be filled. I'd asked for food to be served about 45 minutes after everyone arrived to allow time for our guests to mingle and nibble and sip.  We had a dedicated server, the wonderful Kat, who took care of every little thing, pouring champagne, bringing coffee, whisking away empty glasses. The food (brussels sprouts, duck confit, a few kinds of eggs benedict, steak and frites, a tuna sandwich) was delicious. Damn, I'm wishing I were back there right now. One of my guests, a real foodie, noted how Brad brought out super flavors without leaning on the butter and salt, like many French-style chefs do. And the service was fabulous--very warm and light-hearted, attentive, but not intrusive, not fussy.  This was truly one of the nicest parties I've ever thrown. And I was amazed to find when we  finally left, that it WAS after 3. If I could give six stars I would. I can't wait to go back to Revelry.
author: Nancy T.

description: Wonderful place.  FIVE tables in main dining room.  Small plates win the day.  More promise than performance in main dishes the night I went.  But I'll be back!
author: John M.

description:
Food was OK.  Good but not great.  Salmon was undercooked, and the sauce was heavy.  

Service was poor.  The waiter interrupted our conversation repeatedly and intentionally.  He seemed annoyed we were there.  Hurried us along as soon as we were done.  

I live right next door to this restaurant and wouldn't come back.
author: Jeff S.

description: Incredible little European gem, epic neighborhood charm and hospitality. Crudo and oysters fresh and perfect, I've had the gnocchi twice, sweetie loved every bite of his boeuf. Wine pairing lovely, gracious with tasting before buying a glass. A new favorite!!
author: Spunky M.

description: Great food and great service. It was a bit empty when we went in on a Friday night but it was also raining which could have been why. It's also BYOB with a corkage fee which is great. Highly recommend.
author: Danielle P.

description: Amazing food and service! I always have oysters! They super fresh and delicious! I also recommend the Filet Mignon Rossini with Foie Grass and top with fresh Truffles from Burgundy!  Tre bon!
author: Tatiana M.

description: Wonderful ambience and excellent food.  When you walk in it feels like returning to your favorite restaurant, warm and welcoming.  The specials are always great and top notch wine list.
author: Z E W.

description: Have been meaning this place for a while. It was a real stand-out for us, not only for the food but also because of the friendliness of the staff. We shared a charcuterie board to start (delicious!) & I had a duck salad - which had enormous amounts of duck in it = divine! - and my partner had pork chop with grits, which he ate like a starving wolf. We're European & the hankering for excellent French-style food never really goes away - we have definitely found our spot!
author: Fi M.

description: Amazing place. Great food, great staff. Great choice for a date for bringing your parents.
author: James R.

description: Revelry is a perfect and cozy neighborhood gem! My boyfriend and I went for dinner last night and when we were looking through the menu, it reminded me of a very memorable meal we had in the South of France. We ordered the cheese plate, filet mignon, and the gnocchi. All were good, but the cheese plate and the gnocchi dish were my favorite. I can't want to dine back here again.
author: T D.

description: Classic French bistro fare executed at a high level. A lot of love clearly goes in every plate. Little touches stand out, such as the mushrooms sautéed separately from the risotto to keep them crisp and the rice creamy. Filet Mignon was cooked to perfection and should be added to the menu, if it's not already.
author: Michael C.

description: I really wanted to eat here, but we had no luck getting service. When my husband and I arrived, we were told we could wait ten minutes for seats at the bar and another 20 minutes for a table. Unfortunately they had 3 different people managing incoming guests, so when another couple arrived, another hostess seated them immediately and ahead of us at the bar, without checking with her colleagues. My husband, then, simply stood in the doorway until a third server/host asked him if he could help. When my husband said that we were still waiting to be seated, the man casually waved at an open table. We sat down, and they completely ignored us for over 5 minutes (no water, no menu, no service, and we watched the couple who got seated ahead of us drink their wine at the bar). So, we got up and left.
author: Caroline N.

description: Loved the duck confit salad and the hangar steak. Service was top notch as well.
author: Calvin L.

description:
Went here for date night.
The food was solid.  The wine was solid.  The prices were solid.
Would highly recommend and look forward to a repeat visit in the near future to try other menu items.
author: Patrick T.

description: Food was excellent! My only criticism is that it was very warm in the restaurant. The food and service is wonderful, give it a try! I loved it!
author: Dianne S.

description:
We were in the neighborhood on a Saturday night and somehow managed to grab a table for four on opentable.com.  We had no idea what to expect, especially since the menu online was pretty sparse, but what a surprise!  I agree with a reviewer who called it a "gem" because that's exactly what it is. Right when we arrived, we felt welcomed. Everyone working there was friendly and had a smile on their face. We ordered a lot of specials because they all sounded delicious and these are the ones I personally tasted:

French onion soup - Standard but tasty. Portion was on the smaller side. 
Escargot - Standard. Seems to be baked with olive oil instead of butter. Couldn't stop dipping my bread in the sauce.
Bone marrow - Delicious! I really liked the tomato jam that it came with because it helped to cut the rich fattiness.
Duck confit salad - I had a few bites and it was very flavorful yet clean.
Potato gnocchi - If it's on the specials, YOU MUST ORDER! The dish was filled with mushrooms, truffle flavors, and spinach.  It's a little rich but if you can't handle the entire dish, order it for the table.
Filet mignon with foie gras - Rich, decadent and memorable. And the foie gras portion was pretty generous. There was a flavor of star anise that lent an Asian flavor.
Trio of epic cookies - While I liked the rich peanut butter cookie, my friend declared the chocolate one the best she's ever had (and she's not a chocolate person).
Sorbet - We had pomegranate, coconut and raspberry. Flavors were good but texture was a little rough.
author: C L.

description: Stumbled upon this charming bistro near where I live and I'm super glad we tried it out. Their entrées change daily but I had the filet and it was perfect. Topped with a light garlic butter, and served atop some essential carrots and brussels sprouts, it hit the spot nicely. Also tried a bibb salad with almonds, fresh melon and savory bits of cured meats which was the perfect pairing of salty and sweet. May try to recreate this one on my own at home. Service was impeccable too and our waiter helped us pick a nice wine pairing. Overall 10/10, would return.
author: Jake K.

description: Love Chef Brad, I will follow him where ever he goes. He's so talented I can't wait to go back, my taste buds are exploding just thinking about it.
author: Diana T.

description: Ambiance was perfect - intimate, relaxed, and inviting.  Very comfortable dining experience and romantic perfect date night!  Food was incredible from the charcuterie, shrimp, to the desert!  Can't wait to go back!
author: p f.

description:
As soon as you walk in it feels like a quaint and authentic French bistro (busy but not loud). We started with assorted oysters, the charcuterie and cheese plates. We really enjoyed the diversity presented in each. All of our entrees were spectacular (we had issues because we each kept taking bites of each others plates because each were all so delicious:)! The waiter made an excellent recommendation that paired well with each of our different dishes. We were bummed we couldn't do dessert (we were so stuffed from the meal) but we topped the evening off with some strong espressos!
I am really looking forward to coming back!
author: Nadia M.

description: I like the space - good atmosphere.  It was not too loud.  The food & service was good.  My complaint is they only have 4 entree choices.  We were there on a Friday at 7:30 and they were already out of 2 of the choices!!  How can that be?  They substituted for one of the choices, but that still left just 3 choices - steak, fish & a pasta.  Not much of a selection.  I ended up ordering the charcuterie appetizer for my entree.  It was good.  Not sure I'll return because of this.
author: David J.

description: Amazing.  Happened to stop in for dinner and we were impressed.  We were looking for a venue for a wedding brunch so we came back for brunch and again, the food was terrific, the service attentive and friendly.  We decided to do the wedding brunch here and we couldn't have been happier.  We had the room in the back which was very private and easy to move around in. It is perfect for a family or friends celebration where you want restaurant food cooked to order, rather than a banquet, and Jerome couldn't have been more helpful and accommodating.  Our friends were all impressed with the food and the wine selections, and all remarked at how welcome they felt in this very San Francisco French bistro.  Our favorite choices were the Eggs Cocotte and Croque Monsieur, the beet salad and the duck confit salad for brunch.  You won't go wrong with any choice on the menu.  Thanks a bunch, Jerome.
author: dan b.

description: Fabulous food!  Fantastic presentation!  Wonderful experience!  I couldn't wait to see what the next dish would be that came to our table.  What a treat it was to dine at this restaurant.  I am certain it will do very, very well and I look forward to returning soon!
author: Rosie G.

description: Really, really like this new French place just a little removed from Hayes Valley. Both the Brussels sprouts Caesar salad and the duck confit salad were pretty well balanced and the risotto with mushrooms, though a tad on the salty side, was excellent. Wines are reasonably priced and well curated. Atmosphere is delightful: like a dressed up bistro with a homey but slightly elegant vibe. Service was leisurely paced but they never brought us a couple more toast points to go with our baked Camembert.
author: Helen T.

description: This place was a great little spot on the corner in Hayes Valley, and the food was very tasty!  The amount of choice on the menu was a pleasant surprise considering it is a small place.  Great selection of wine and beer as well!  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  It is on our list of places we would visit again.
author: Dave B.

description: everything we ordered was awesome and flavorful. the look of the place is cute and cool and the waiter was great.
author: Natalie B.

description: I arrived her with my husband like 45minutes after our reservation. Our date couple was already seated and enjoying a decanter of wine and some olives. It was sometime before 5 but that still impressed me that they seated them with out the full party. We had the big wood table in the front of the restaurant. The table sucks! I would highly recommend they replace it with something more practical. It seems large but the way the legal are situated it definitely felt cramped with 5 people. The food is absolutely amazing. We ordered almost everything on the menu. The snails were perfectly cooked. Usually they are chewy and just a vehicle for garlic and butter. These could have been plain and they would have still been perfect! The sweat breads are ridiculous! Even the mushrooms the thymus gland sat atop were good. Our couple contains a Brazilian who was very happy with their salt cod. He kept saying this takes 3 days to make. I find French food to be very simple. It doesn't typically have strong flavors that can overshadow poor technique. This restaurant could easily be in France. Well, except the service is also great! Everything from the beet salad to the desert was truly spectacular. This is easily on of the best French restaurants in the city.
author: Corey Jace W.

description: This place is great. It's right on my corner and has simple, but very delicious food. Excellent cheese platter and oysters. Solid beer and wine selection, and extremely kind and attentive staff. Would definitely recommend.
author: Chris S.

description: This place is wonderful - amazing food, amazing service. Jerome really knows his wine and food, and made our meal memorable. Reasonable prices for such good, well made food. The dessert was incredible - handmade French nougat.
author: Andrea K.

description: Fantastic French bistro where you can find splurgy classic favorites like bone marrow, oysters and escargot. We had the radishes, foie gras torchon, pork belly and filet mignon. Everything was tasty and seasoned well. The foie with shaved truffle was divine with a perfect portion size for 2 (or 4 for a taste). My rare filet was perfectly cooked and paired with simple but classic potatoes and green beans. My boyfriend's pork belly was wow. The meat was tender, and the skin was shatteringly crisp. It came with these warm apricots that were surprising and addictive. Lovely meal overall. A tad pricy to be called an everyday bistro option (like say, Chez Maman), but certainly not breaking the bank for the quality of food. Service was attentive, warm and friendly. Wine and beer list extensive and nicely-curated. Atmosphere inviting and spacious with plenty of tables to accommodate both large and small groups.
author: Michelle F.

description:
We noticed that a new restaurant has opened in our hood and decided to give it a try last night. It was extremely busy but even so the owner took the time to have a chat with us . He and his fiancé are so sweet and passionate about Revelry! 

We shared a cheese and charcuterie board that was a perfect way to start. We also had the braised short rib which was amazing!! Food was gorgeously presented and delicious! 

We are so happy for this couple starting a new business and wish them much luck! We will be back for sure!
author: J R.

description: Actually, 3 and a half stars. Wife and I came here on a Saturday evening at about 5 PM, earlier than our reserved time of 5:30 PM.  We were cordially greeted and seated immediately upstairs, which has about 4 intimate tables and a large central table for about ten persons.  This room was much more esthetically pleasing than downstairs which was more like a bar.  We ordered a dozen assorted oysters and the beef marrow for appetizers.  The oysters were super fresh and delicious as others' reviews indicate.  They somehow forgot that we also ordered the marrow, so we wound up eating them (four yummy pieces) after the main courses.  Wife had the fish (some sort of white fish), which was OK but rather dry.  I had the tournedos Rossini topped with seared foie gras, which was perfectly cooked (medium rare on the rarer side), and, with the foie gras,, it was absolutely delicious. After the marrow dessert (!), we were quite full and skipped the dessert.  The service was solicitous, friendly, and prompt except for the faux pas concerning bone marrow.  We also enjoyed the background music of French chansons and Nora Jones.  Overall, we enjoyed our dinner here and will be back for the oysters and tournedos.
author: Hoyle L.

description: We discovered Revelry Bistro last night and are thrilled to have found such a great restaurant in the neighborhood. The menu is interesting, the served portions are ample, the owners are charming, and the wait staff pleasant and helpful. We ordered Osso Buco, mushroom risotto, and grilled salmon for main courses. For starters we had ahi poke, bone marrow, and chicken liver pate. We all loved our own food and everyone else's as well. I can't wait to go back.
author: Terry H.

description: $1 oysters? Yes please. Everything else is yummy and with good portions for the price including the wine. Welcome to the hood!
author: Ella M.

description: A quaint spot to meet a pal for wine and a perfect array of cheeses, oysters, soups, and salads. In fact, my girlfriend and I ended up closing the restaurant down and had the opportunity to meet the owner, who is super passionate about his craft and excited to mingle with his patrons to come up with his next great offering. I would recommend this place to anyone in the mood for a humming SF eatery in a tucked away historic neighborhood.And with a killer brunch set to launch in a few weeks, this place will definitely be a summer go to
author: Kiki N.

description: I'd heard great things about the restaurant and was excited to try it. I knew it was the new venture of an excellent local chef, Brad Roth, who has never failed to deliver in the past. I was not disappointed! The crudo was superb, and the filet melted in my mouth! Not to mention the truffle butter on top! AND the bacon brittle on the salad was delicious! The presentation was beautiful and generous as well. Oh did I mention the bone marrow seasoned to perfection? An excellent way to feed the soul on a Saturday night!
author: Angelina K.
